intro: Mulgedium djimilense, commonly known as the Djimilense fern, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate fronds with a delicate, lacy appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are located on the underside of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mulgedium djimilense is considered a species of conservation concern.
